It is an inflation adjusted account of the 2005-06 season transfer window which illustrates what the players we bought then would cost in today's money. It's not my inflation adjustment ‚Äì it's based on the link Ryan shared and the Transfermarkt transfer prices for each of the players.
I have converted the Euro Transfermarkt figures to ¬£ based on today's currency exchange rate. I haven't gone back in time to find out what the currency exchange was 20 years ago. I'm not sad...
Anyway, these are the main players we bought (alongside Neville) in season 2005-06 ‚Äì and their prices in today's money:
Neville: ¬£24.86M
Davies: ¬£25M
Kroldrup: ¬£32.33M
Van der Meyde: ¬£42.77M
Arteta: ¬£13.2M
Total: ¬£138.24M
I'm not saying this to do Moyes down by the way. He definitely did assemble a very good side (and rebuild it too) during his first stint with us. He also plainly didn't have the resources of the then Rich 6. Many summers came and went with very little investment at all - or practically none.
ps: Happy to admit I was wrong in saying Moyes bought Haller too (I'm not trying to stitch him up). Moyes did also personally unearth and scout many of these players too, showing a greater attention to long-term stability and improvement than many of his peers at the time √ú albeit in a simpler era that preceded the hugely data-driven, professionalised business of player (including youth player) trading and development.
